name: Hilton Molino Stucky Venice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights at Molino Stucky before boarding a cruise to Dalmatia and one day (day room) before flying back home in the evening. The two nights were in a suite thanks to a kind complimentary upgrade; the day room was a basic queen size room, which is quite spacious.
reviews.title: Hilton quality, many pros and some cons

reviews.text: We chose this hotel because it is just in front of the cruise terminal (however, the cost of a water taxi to cross the Giudecca Canal is around 60 euro ... for some 800 meters; but this is Venice).
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel - Great Service

reviews.text: The pros :
reviews.title: Pity it wasn't longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hilton standards : kind reception, efficient concierge, perfectly clean room; very quiet location on Giudecca, free shuttle to Zattere and San Marco, smiling service; above all, great restoration of an industrial building, unique rooftop swimming pool and bar with fantastic views; one can really relax after an exhausting day in Venice; some good restaurants within walking distance (a.o. Cipriani, really worth a visit).
reviews.title: Best of Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cons :
reviews.title: Great Hilton

reviews.text: Not to be too dramatic but I felt like I had died and gone to heaven when I arrived at this hotel. It was so beautiful. My favorite thing about the hotel was the views! View from my hotel room, view from the restaurant windows, and view from the pool. I had spent the first half of my trip at a local hotel in the main area of Venice and although it was also a great experience, the Stucky made me never want to leave. If you want to go all out in Venice, do it right and stay at this property.
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth

reviews.text: Only negative (and who really cares, just letting you know) is that wifi gets really spotty after the third floor in the main tower, most people were using their tablets and phones in the lobby or breakfast area. So if internet connection is your thing, keep this in mind.
reviews.title: Great place if you don't want to experience local color

reviews.text: There is no denying that this is a quality hotel in a very nice facility. But the place is huge, confusing and let's face it, not really "in" Venice. We tried, unsuccessfully, to find the spa and pool on our second evening and thought we were going to have to call for search and rescue to get back to our room.
reviews.title: Comfortable place a short boat ride away from San Marco square

reviews.text: But our room was lovely. After an initial mix-up - being given a room with one bed when we had requested two, and even called the morning of arrival to re-confirm - we were quickly moved to a better room, on a corner with views of the Giudecca canal in two directions. (This is not the "Grand Canal" of Venice as stated in an earlier review. The Grand Canal is not visible from this property.) I found the additional transportation time and logistics of staying on the island to be limiting, causing us to do fewer evening activities than we otherwise might.
reviews.title: Good - But Can A Hotel This Size Ever Offer The Personal Touch?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Access to the Executive Lounge (Hilton Gold members) was a plus that definitely saved on breakfast and an evening glass of wine or two. The food offerings, though, were way below average for a Hilton.
reviews.title: Yucky in the Stucky

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for the ambiance of a historic Venetion property with the comfort and security of a North American style hotel, the Hilton Molino Stucky is for you. Situated on the island of Guidecca, you are a hop, skip, and jump on the hotel's own water taxi service, or the public service nearby to all that Venice has to offer, including the Main Island, the ferry terminal and San Marco Square. The island is much quieter than San Marco, but so close! The rooms are small (but it IS Venice, so to be expected) but modern, and well equipped. The rooftop bar and pool are really enjoyable. Dinner at the hotel restaurant was very good (is there bad food in Italy?). However, la piece de resistance is the morning hotel buffet.....OMG - this is some of the best food in the world. From fresh cheeses, to fresh fish, to fresh yoghurts, to fresh prepared foods, to fresh coffee......I could go on and on. It was fabulous.
reviews.title: North American Comforts in Venice

reviews.text: We had a very good rate of about 140 euro in high season, breaskfast included, for a smallish but well equipped and modern room. But, hey, when in Venice, you don't go there to sleep.
reviews.title: I HAD TERRIBLE MOMENTS AT THIS PLACE

reviews.text: One peice of advice - Everything in Venice takes 10 times as long to acheive, so allow lots of time to get to the airport on your departure. There is no such thing a fast water taxi in Venice, and they are rarely on time.
reviews.title: convenient location, nice views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I could have a much better experience at this hotel. The structure is amazing, the staff not so amazing.
reviews.title: Far and quite still so close

reviews.text: I am a diamond member and I invited friend to stay with us. I did not receive a upgrade for my room and stayed in a tiny room, but for my surprise, my guest received and amazing room, a super upgrade…it was my first disappointment.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience and Great Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on our honeymoon in December 2012 and couldn't have been happier. From the location to the AMAZING breakfast to the supremely comfortable beds, it was an awesome experience to stay here. The staff are genuinely nice and helpful. In fact, when I got strep throat while I was there, the concierge called a bunch of local pharmacies to see who could prescribe me some antibiotics on a Sunday (when most everything is closed). It was a truly special visit and I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Venice!
reviews.title: Great location & service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Venice the first week in December and stayed at the Hilton to take advantage of our points. We were upgraded to an executive suite which was very nice and comfortable. It was in the back part of the hotel so it was very quiet but did not have a view of Venice which was ok but something to be aware of. We used the complimentary services of the executive lounge quite a bit especially for breakfast which saved time and money and the view from there is awesome. The shuttle boat was so convenient and always on time, and being off season we were sometimes the only people on it. We did not at all feel we missed anything because we were not staying on the main part of Venice. Service was friendly but professional. We did pay a deposit for a converter for our electric devices and after three of them blew out within minutes our deposit was refunded and the concierge told us where to buy one that worked very well for the rest of our trip. This hotel may not have the ambience of some of the smaller hotels and B&Bs in Venice but it is a beautiful, efficiently run hotel with professional staff and all the services you could ask for. We would recommend it with no hesitations.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have just returned from staying here for four nights.We were here for my wife's 65th birthday treat she knew nothing about it until we got to Gatwick airport. I had requested that if possible could the hotel do something special as a birthday treat I was hoping for perhaps a cake or flowers. But to our great suprise they upgraded us to a suite complete with a cake and a bottle of prossecco and membership of the excecutive club for the duration of our stay..The hotel ran it's own 40 seater boat frequently across to Dorsoduro or St Marks so no problems there the staff were charming the choice at breakfast amazing .The older hotels are lovely but this recently converted flour mill was beautifully done with all mod cons and loads of comfortable places to sit after your days walking top marks thanks to all the staff
reviews.title: lovely hotel with the best views of Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the minute you walk into this hotel, you know you are in an upscale resort setting. Hilton has done a wonderful job from the amazing lobby, different restaurant selections, and wonderful breakfast buffets, to the rooftop pool, on-site history and superior customer service. Would highly recommend staying here and can't wait to return.
reviews.title: Simply The Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 3rd visit to Venice in 5 years so we didn't feel the need to be in the middle of things. We couldn't have asked for a better place to be. We arrived after 24 hours in transit and were provided an upgraded room (suite) overlooking the Grand Canal. It was lovely, comfortable, and quiet. The hotel provides regular shuttle boat service to the piazza directly across the canal (where we ventured around back areas for dinner--comfortable, not too crowded, and good food), as well as regular service to St Mark's Square. Getting to the hotel from the airport wasn't exactly convenient but that can be said for any of the Venice hotels, and after that, we had no issues. We had reservations that included the buffet breakfast, which was excellent in variety, taste, and service. We were going from the hotel to our cruise ship the next day (easy and inexpensive on the regular vaporetto service), and the hotel concierge was very helpful in making sure we understood how that worked and how easy it would be so that we didn't need to spend an exorbitant amount for a water taxi. The hotel was an old flour mill, and it's amazing to look at all of the pictures both of the active mill and the work that was needed to make it into a top of the line hotel, very high end but comfortable. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: My family and I stayed for 2 nights at the Hilton Molino Stuckey Venice right after New Year's. It is a wonderful hotel although the location is away from the main tourist sites in Venice. There is a hotel boat shuttle which takes you to Piazza San Marco and runs every 20 minutes or so. Personally, I found it much easier and more relaxing staying at the Hilton Molino Stuckey Venine than the more quaint hotels on the main island where I have stayed before.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was the most lavish in all of Italy, and the rooms were large and comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel for business or leisure travelers who do not need to stay on the main island in Venice. It is also located near the water taxi spot, so trips elsewhere in Venice or to the Marco Polo Airport are not a problem.
reviews.title: Do not stay - not worth the price.

reviews.text: Got to the hotel after quite a crazy journey. Car taxi ride to marina. Told this is as far as he can take us. 45 euros. At docks no idea which boat taxi to board or how we pay for it. Lovely italian lady told us to board a certain one which we did. Didnt pay. Wernt asked. Had no idea if we were meant to. Dropped us 5 mins walk from hotel so had to cart our luggage till there. Dark and late so weren't impressed. Never had issues getting to a hotel or feeling lost and clueless before. Jump into taxi an we are dropped off at doorstep. But ah well at least on way back we can make sure hotel helps us get back to airport easier.
reviews.title: A luxury retreat you wouldn't mind being stuck-y at

reviews.text: Came into the hilton an there was no one to greet us. We had to ask where we needed to go. Pointed to reception to a guy with black hair and glasses. Unfortunately didn't take this mans name. Found him quite arrogant. Yes we are clueless foreigners and have to be spoon-fed on whats what. It is your job to be friendly and courteous. This man seemed so impatient and uninterested. Then no porters to take our luggage up. Unusual experience for us.
reviews.title: A Disappointment

reviews.text: Later that evening we realised no where to eat besides hotel. Too tired to go on shuttle to find somewhere on main island. So hotel restaurant it was. Only one open near reception. Disgusting food at extortionate prices. But seeing as we had no choice ate enough to survive.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes it is a great and beautiful hotel, location is fabulous, easy access to famous St Marks Square with hotel's private shuttle boat, rooftop pool is beyond the excellent, wide variety of breakfast and very delicious. Hilton luxury meets the expectations.
reviews.title: It is great but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: BUT there is a disappointing point that should be awared of; Executive lounge.
reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have booked an executive king room, view of the sea and Venice is perfect, despite all The executive room did not meet the standards, not so spacious, and the executive lounge needs to be proved. Indeed it must be named as "executive corner" whis is located entry floor of the hotel near the lobby area and is bordered with iron bars. You may feel yourself as an animal in zoo, people in the looby are watching you. They have to change the concept Executive Lounge to Executive Corner. That was not suit to the Brand Hilton!
reviews.title: I rate average, but it is not an average hotel. Outstanding in both directions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights on the tail end of our 12-day Princess Cruise. The hotel was beautiful and staff was gracious and accommodating to American travelers. The complimentary water taxi to travel across the canal was most convenient and accessible. We had an executive suite that included a wonderful breakfast and complimentary, private lounge with snacks, hors d'oeuvre, wine, beer, soft drinks, tea, coffee, throughout the day and evening. I highly recommend this hotel to American travelers visiting the enchanted City of Venice!
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is impressive, from outside as well as from inside, it is an example of industrial archeology recovered.
reviews.title: Good hotel in Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the San Lucia Train Station around 7 AM after taking an overnight train from Croatia. The train station isn't that close to the hotel, but there are a variety of travel options to get there. We decided to walk, so we could see some of the city before we got to the hotel. It was somewhat difficult since we were carrying our bags and Venice isn't the easiest place to navigate. The hotel is located on Giudecca Island, which is part of the Dorsoduro district. The hotel provides a free shuttle to and from Giudecca Island to Zattere and Saint Mark's Square, so it is very convenient. When we arrived, our room was upgraded by the front desk, so we could go to our room right away. The room was beautiful and the hotel ammenities were numerous. There are several restaurants, bars, the rooftop pool is incredible, and the fitness/wellness center is decently equipped. The concierge was very helpful with providing information about restaurants (we ended up going to Trattoria ai Cacciatori, which is about a 10 minutes walk from the hotel), attractions, and our travel option to the airport the following day (water bus is cheapest, but takes an hour).
reviews.title: Secluded, yet easily accessible hotel.

reviews.text: Stayed at the Hilton Stucky for a few nights while in Venice. We had a executive king plus room with lovely views out to Venice. It was room 432 just below the old mill sign, the itself was very small for £500 per night when spoke to reception to see if we could get something a little larger as it was our anniversary and also paying such a high rateam. The answer was sorry madame but this is Venice, what does that mean? Is that mean its okay to charge £500 per night for such a small room. Anyways back to all the positives wasn't going to let this little issue spoil our break, how long where we going to spend in the room anyway. The shuttle bus service is great and very regular it makes your visits into town so romantic and great fun, only takes 10 mins and stops at two places, get off at the first stop and take the 30min walk into St Marks square through the old streets and bridges great way to see Venice. Venice is the most romantic city I have ever been to really enchanting. Back tot the hotel, it has a great roof top bar with fab views spent many a night drinking champagne up there and the music is great and candlelit at night. There is a roof top swimming pool which is amazing great way to unwing for an hour before dinner, the executive lounge is ok for drinks and little nibbles never ate at the hotel always in Venice and the food in the town is great. I have rebooked the Hilton for some of my family going out next week for a few days so I do recommend it.
reviews.title: One of Hiltons best

reviews.text: We stayed two nights at the Hilton Molino Stucky in Venice after disembarking from a cruise. Wanting to experience the culinary delights of Venice, we endured an exhausting excursion which required numerous water shuttles, water taxis and the connection times that go with such a trek... and it was not even close to being worth the time, energy or the money (and it had a great rating on TripAdvisor!). Upon returning to the Molino Stucky, I discussed this with Marko Ludovici, the front office manager who compassionately convinced me to try the Hilton's gourmet restaurant "Aromi."
reviews.title: A wonderful Hotel - a Fabulous Restaurant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next evening after an exhausting day of sightseeing in the heat, instead of embarking on yet another tiresome "adventure in travel!" - we simply dressed and took the elevator to the lobby, then strolled out the door and into the wonderful, gracious care of Giovanni Burrafato, the maestro and maître d' of "Aromi." Stunningly, Giovanni transformed "having dinner" into "fine dining" Venician style! It was an evening that resenbled a symphony of elegance and grace. Excellent food, unbelievable service, an event we will never forget. Giovanni gave us memories of Venice that matched the dreams we'd had of Venice!
reviews.title: July, 2011 Stay

reviews.text: So if you are staying at the Molino Stucky and find yourself exhausted from a day sightseeing, consider "dining in." You have one of Venice's finest restaurants litterally at your door!
reviews.title: Incredible - most of all the rooftop pool

reviews.text: This is a very nice property. Our room was superb. The food offerings in the club lounge were great.
reviews.title: Very nice property
Great stay
reviews.text: Helpful Staff . Super accommodations. A little hard to find launch site by St Marks.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for one night after a 7 night cruise that disembarked in Venice. Overall, a great looking, comfortable, and convenient hotel.
reviews.title: Only a quick stay, but left with a good impression

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a king room, which was gigantic by Venetian (or even European) standards, with a huge bathroom, modern furnishings, and a charming view of the Giudecca Canal where we could see the cruise ships coming and going. The hotel itself was very large, modern, and well decorated. It had a boutiquey vibe that is probably not too common in Venice.
reviews.title: Truly 5 star experience!

reviews.text: Even though the hotel is located on Giudecca, the convenient shuttle boat made us feel like we were still in the middle of the action. The boat was always on schedule (both departing and returning to the hotel) and took only about 10 minutes.
reviews.title: Great and then some!

aka: Hilton Molino Stucky Venice Hotel Venice
description: The Molino Stucky Hilton Venice has opened its doors on June 2007 and can be considered one of Europe’s most ambitious architectural restoration projects in recent years. The hotel has been created by reuniting the buildings that were once part of the Stucky Flour Mill which dates back to 1895 and counts 379 rooms including 88 executive rooms and 44 suites. We are the only hotel in Venice to offer a five-star spa and an amazing panoramic rooftop pool overlooking Venice and the Lagoon. The exclusive Skyline Rooftop Bar delights our guests with delicious cocktails with a breathtaking landscape of the city.
